title: Bug 31627 - DBCS: Core Dump on Perspective Change with DBCS Project
description: The issue is related to a core dump that occurs after adding a DBCS (Double-Byte Character Set) project to the workspace when changing the perspective. This bug report includes details about the environment and steps to reproduce the problem.
OB: After adding a DBCS project to the workspace, changing the perspective results in a core dump. The issue is specific to DBCS projects in Eclipse IDE, running on RedHat8 with a Japanese locale (jaJP.eucJP), using GTK 2.2 and IBM JDK1.3.1 + SR3.
EB: When adding a DBCS project to the workspace and changing the perspective, the application should not crash. It should handle DBCS projects seamlessly during perspective changes.
SR:
To reproduce the problem, follow these steps:
1. Create a project using DBCS characters.
2. Right-click the project and select 'Team' -> 'Share project...'
3. Select the CVS repository
4. Select the 'Use project name as module name' option and click 'Finish'
5. Select the project in the Synchronize view
6. Right-click on the project and select 'Add Version Control'
7. Right-click on the project and select 'Commit'
8. Right-click on the project and select 'Delete' (Select 'also delete contents under /workspace folder name')
9. Change the perspective to 'CVS perspective'
10. Expand the repository and 'HEAD'
11. Right-click on the DBCS project and select 'Check Out As Project'
12. Observe the core dump that occurs after the perspective change.
